Here's the link BOLK:

http://www.rtb.gov.bn/layout_news_archive_2005.html

Just click on August 29. Its the very first news item.

The speech wasnt in English but I could tell P.Sarah spoke confidently. Everytime I see video footage of her I forget she's only 18. Very poised and regal indeed.

It was for her participation in the University of Toronto Biology Competition. Usually people who just got a participation certificate would not go on stage to receive the certificate. I guess it was just a way to honour Her Highness' participation in it. Her cert is not really an award. But the ceremony was actually intended to present Awards for students who got into the top 100 ranks.

Recently, there was a 9-ball pool competition in Brunei in which the crown prince participated. She was there to watch him play.

She's just so sweet. I watched her on the Brunei news via the link posted for Aug 29th, and I realised that she probably doesn't speak Malay at home! Her Malay is melodious, but there is a very distinct English accent, and the general intonation indicates that she doesn't use Malay as an everyday language. Anyway countries like Brunei and Singapore where the Malays speak English more fluently than Malay is nothing uncommon.

Dang, she's just so sweet!

HRH at Guides ceremony

Her Royal Highness Paduka Seri Pengiran Anak Isteri Pengiran Anak Sarah attended a prize presentation ceremony for Al-Quran readers of the Brunei Darussalam Girl Guides Association yesterday at Jerudong Park and Country Club.

http://www.brunei-online.com/weekend/news/oct1h4.htm

[font=Times New Roman, Times, serif]HRH leads Queen's Baton Relay [/font]

Her Royal Highness Paduka Seri Pg Anak Isteri Pg Anak Sarah yesterday consented to take part in the 18th Commonwealth Games Queen's Baton Relay, which began and ended at the National Stadium in Berakas.

http://www.brunei-online.com/bb/mon/oct3h2.htm

[FONT=Times New Roman, Times, serif]Her Royal Highness among Science College graduates [/FONT]

Her Royal Highness Paduka Seri Pengiran Anak Isteri Pg Anak Sarah was among 129 students who received their graduation certificates and souvenirs in the Graduation Ceremony for Pra-University 2 (2005) of the Paduka Seri Begawan Sultan Science College which took place at the Auditorium, yesterday afternoon.

.....Also present were the Deputy Minister of Education, Pg Dato Seri Setia Dr. Hj Mohammad bin Pg Hj Abd Rahman, and Dato Paduka Sheikh Hj Adnan bin Sheikh Mohammad, Permanent Secretary at the Ministry as well as parents of the graduating students including both parents of HRH Paduka Seri Pengiran Anak Isteri Pg Anak Sarah.

http://www.brunei-online.com/sunday/news/jan15h20.htm

Pictures from Infofoto

I think that's one of Princess Sarah's brothers in the last picture.
